citation.article-title: Adhaeribacter aquaticus gen. nov., sp. nov., a Gram-negative isolate from a potable water biofilm.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Adhaeribacter aquaticus sp. nov.
Adhaeribacter aquaticus (a.qua′ti.cus. L. masc. adj. aquaticus living, growing, or found in or by water, aquatic).
Displays the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Colonies on R2A agar are circular, entire, pink and not easily emulsified.
Cells are 2·8–4·1 μm in length and 0·9–1·7 μm in width.
Weak hydrolysis of starch is observed.
Tests for nitrate reduction, H2S production and indole production are negative.
Growth occurs in the range 4–37 °C and the optimal temperature for growth is 30 °C.
NaCl is not required for growth; up to 4·0 % (w/v) NaCl is tolerated.
Acid and gas are not produced from d-glucose.
Adonitol, arabinose, d-fructose, d-gluconate, d-glucose, inositol, N-acetyl d-glucosamine, pyruvate, d-ribose, sucrose and d-trehalose are assimilated.
Citrate, fumarate, galactose, d-lactate, lactose, malonate, d-maltose, d-mannose, d-rhamnose, salicin, sorbitol, suberate and xylose are not utilized.
Hydrolysis of α-d-glucoside, β-d-glucoside bisphosphate, N-acetylglucosamine phosphate, phosphorylcholine, α-galactoside and β-galactoside detectable.

Susceptible to methicillin, imipenem, gentamicin, trimethoprim, cefoperazone, vancomycin, erythromycin, carbenicillin, ciprofloxacin, cefotaxime, fusidic acid, cefsulodin, piperacillin, penicillin G, tobramycin, amikacin and ticarcillin.
The DNA G+C content is 40·0 mol%.
The type strain is MBRG1.5T (=DSM 16391T=NCIMB 14008T), isolated from a freshwater biofilm, developed in a model system, which was exposed to a fluid velocity of 0·26 m s−1 over a 3-month period.
